title: Can you solve the river crossing riddle? - Lisa Winer

multiple-choice.question: According to law professor Brian C. Kalt, what is the loophole in the Constitution of the United States that allows a person to potentially get away with murder in the "zone of death"?

options.label: A
options.text: The lack of jurisdiction in Idaho

options.label: B

options.text: The Vicinage Clause

options.text: A clause that requires a trial to take place in the state where the crime was committed

options.label: B

options.label: D
options.text: A clause that allows a person to waive their right to a trial

options.label: C
options.text: Because the Constitution does not allow for it

options.label: D
options.text: Because the judge is biased

options.label: A
options.text: To redraw the district lines so that the district of Wyoming is Wyoming, the district of Idaho is Idaho, and the district of Montana is Montana

options.label: B
options.text: To create a new district court for the "zone of death"

options.label: C
options.text: To allow a person to waive their right to a trial

options.label: D
options.text: To hold a trial in a different state

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The world of Forms is a separate reality that exists independently of our world.

options.label: D
options.text: The world of Forms is a product of human imagination.

options.label: B
